title: Technical Data Analyst
description:
Summary
Posted: May 3, 2024
Weekly Hours: 40...
Role Number:200549486

Imagine what you could do here. The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it.

Apple is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our Worldwide Sales Data Operations team. In this position, you will lead immersive exploration of Apple’s marketing and sales datasets by applying various data discovery and modeling methodologies while working cross functional with different data owners and analysts. You will work from inception of a specified business problem through delivery and evolution of data solutions to support our Channel Sales teams and drive impact for years to come. If you enjoy solving complex business problems through governed data deliverables, we encourage you to apply.

Key Qualifications

Key Qualifications
• 8+ years of experience in data quality, data analysis, or similar role
• Experience profiling data to assess current state against business needs and identifying criteria to evaluate exceptions
• Ability to translate business needs into detailed data requirements, supported by prototyping the data requirements to drive business decisions
• Knowledge of Marketing and Sales business workflows and applications
• Familiarity with data integrations, modeling and warehousing principles
• Knowledge of version control and testing strategies for data solution delivery
• Programming skills in SQL required
• Experience with agile project delivery methodologies such as Scrum
• Deep understanding of best practice data governance and master data management workflows
• Ability to operate comfortably and effectively in a fast-paced, highly cross-functional, rapidly changing environment.
• Self-motivated and proactive with demonstrated critical thinking and creative problem solving skills
• Excellent communication and presentation skills, written and verbal, with the ability to filter and distill relevant information for audiences at all levels of the organization
• Experience with large software implementations is a plus

Description

Description
In this role, you will:

- Be responsible for functional testing of data development to ensure adherence to functional specifications.
- Support the data decision making process by analyzing data and providing prototype results per requirement so the data owners can make informed decisions
- Perform scheduled data audits to ensure quality compliance
- Plan and drive execution of prioritized data cleansing activities
- Proactively communicate data methodology and results to a diverse set of stakeholders
- Partner with data stewards, data architects, data scientists and engineering teams to meet the data needs of the business, translating business needs into data / technical requirements
- Ensure effective and efficient data management by upholding Apple’s high standards for data governance and quality

Education & Experience

Education & Experience
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience

Additional Requirements

Additional Requirements

title: Data Analyst V-604590
company_name: Texas Health and Human Services Commission
description:
Job Description:
The Data Analyst V performs highly complex (senior level) data analysis, data research, database management, and application development assignments for the Data Management Unit within Information and Data Management Division, Office of Data, Analytics, and Performance (ODAP). Detects data trends and anomalies and provides HHSC programs and executive management with information... necessary to make data-informed management decisions and explores potential program efficiencies. Work involves conducting detailed analysis of data sets, performing data needs assessment, data acquisition, cleaning and standardization, extraction, transformation and loading into database systems; designing, coding, testing, implementing and maintaining computer applications to increase efficiency through the automation of routine tasks. Mentors ODAP staff in the use of compiled datasets. Works under limited supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

Essential Job Functions:
EJF #1: Conducts detailed analysis of data sets to extract insights and detect trends. Performs data needs assessments, acquisition, cleaning, and standardization. Leads extraction, transformation, and loading processes into database systems. Designs, codes, tests, implements, and maintains computer applications to increase efficiency.

EJF #2: Consults, collaborates, and coordinates with HHSC IT, Texas Shared Technology Services, and data trading partners to maintain and troubleshoot computer applications and data management processes. Initiates and coordinates projects to refresh and upgrade database software and server operating systems. Ensures server and database configurations are updated to maintain connectivity with HHSC systems and data trading partners. Provides triage support for applications and databases to resolve functional and performance issues.

EJF #3: Consult with ODAP staff to identify programmatic and business needs. Conducts data needs assessments. Plans, designs, and develops data systems to meet ODAP data needs. Consults and coordinates with ODAP and other HHSC staff to identify potential areas for increased efficiencies and data flow automation. Conducts data profiling and data analysis to identify data quality issues and recommend improvements. Develops project plans, objectives, and timelines and executes them. Identifies and incorporates innovative solutions to streamline workflows and processes.

EJF #4: Prepares and reviews a variety of written, oral, and graphical deliverables containing analyses of Health and Human Services data to detect data trends, outliers, and anomalies, and provides HHSC programs and leadership with information necessary to make informed decisions on streamlining workflows and processes, modification of existing data models, and recommendations on the enhancement of database system architecture. Develops and maintains data quality and data governance processes to ensure accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data in the warehouses.

EJF # 5: Trains DAP staff on ODAP Data Repository (ODAP DR) and Quality Assurance and Improvement (QAI) Datamart applications and systems. Identifies areas for learning and development and participates in training programs available to HHSC and DAP staff members. Mentors ODAP staff in the use of data systems.

Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of the process of computer application development.
Knowledge of Oracle 19c on the Linux platform
Knowledge of data warehouse architecture of Star and Snowflake schemas used in relational, dimensional, and multi-dimensional data modeling.
Knowledge of scripting language to import and extract database information in a Linux batch environment – preferably PERL.
Knowledge of scientific research methods, statistical techniques, mathematics, geographical concepts, and their application to data analytics.
Knowledge of the various Texas Health and Human Service (HHS) programs.
Knowledge of patient level health and demographic data (e.g., Census, Vital, Medicaid, and CHIP data including eligibility, enrollment, medical claims, and encounters).
Knowledge of the principals, practices and techniques of database design and development, database structures and theories and current database technologies.
Knowledge of medical records systems or clinical coding practices.
Knowledge of Internet and World Wide Web.
Knowledge of computer programming principles, spreadsheet macros, and database design.
Skill in developing computer applications using high level interpreted languages such as Perl.
Skill in using SAS, SPSS, SQL, R, ACCESS, Business Objects, or other statistical and database management software.
Skill in using EXCEL or other spreadsheet software.
Skill in graphical, tabular, and geographical presentation of data.
Skill in verbal and written communications.
Skill in database management with Oracle, SQL Server, or similar large database systems.
Ability to analyze and solve problems.
Ability to design, develop, code, test, implement, maintain, and document computer applications.
Ability to manage, manipulate, and analyze complex databases.
Ability to Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources into the data warehouse using tools like Informatica, PERL, and Linux shell scripts.
Ability to oversee and/or supervise the work of others.
Ability to plan, organize, and conduct data analytic projects.
Ability to work in a team and to communicate effectively.
Ability to develop and interpret statistical data charts, maps, and tables.
Ability to interpret and publish data analytic findings.
Ability to exercise independent judgment and show initiative.
Ability to maintain detailed and organized documentation of data analytic projects.
Ability to train staff in the use of data systems.

Registration or Licensure Requirements:
N/A

Initial Selection Criteria:
Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university. Major coursework in computer science, computer information systems, database management, information systems management, or a related field is preferred. Experience in database administration, developing and running complex queries to retrieve data from transactional databases, and/or conducting extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes may be substituted for education on a year for year basis.

MOS Code:
25B, IT,3D0X4

title: Data Analyst IV
description:
WHAT WE DO

The mission of Texas Commission on Law Enforcement (TCOLE) is to ensure that Texas is served by law enforcement professionals. We are the regulatory body that oversees the licensing and certification of peace officers, jailers, and telecommunicators across the state. The Data team reports to the Data Officer, under the IT Operations team and works closely with the Public Information... Team, Application Development Team, Cybersecurity, and Network team to produce and support TCOLE's data-driven mission.

GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The person in this role will be able to query data, ensure accuracy, and transform it into digestible visuals. If you are looking to join a growing IT team in a small State agency that has a big reach and great impact on Texas law enforcement, this is the job for you!

Work involves complex (senior-level) data analysis work involving writing complex SQL database queries and reporting results. Works under general supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. Works both independently and with other staff in performing work of greater complexity.

This position reports in person to the TCOLE Headquarters building at 6330 E Hwy 290, suite 200, Austin, TX 78723.
WORK PERFORMED

Collects, queries, and analyzes data using standard statistical tools, applications, methods, and techniques.

Interprets data analysis results to identify significant differences and trends in data to inform decisions.

Creates data visualizations to represent the data.

Consults with internal and external customers to identify data analytics needs.

Cleans and prunes data to discard irrelevant information.

Responds to time-sensitive ad-hoc open records requests.

Provides recommendations for the selection of data management tools and the development of standards, usage guidelines, and procedures for those tools.

Develops data quality measures, analyzes data quality results, and implements necessary changes to ensure data quality improvement.

Performs related work as assigned.
EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION

Four (4) years experience and/or education in a field relevant data analytics. Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major course work in a field relevant to the assignment is generally preferred. Experience and education may be substituted for one another.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

Strong SQL database query skills

Ability to utilize data visualization tools

Ability to find patterns in data and interpret data

Ability to prep and clean data

Experience with data management and data quality tools

Strong communication skills

Problem solving, critical thinking, and decision making skills

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Familiarity with Power BI and/or MicroStrategy

Familiarity with Microsoft Office 365 tools

title: Sr. Data Analyst
description:
Data is deeply embedded in the product, engineering, quality
and customer experience culture at Tesla. As a Sr. Data Analyst, you will help
to identify & resolve issues that affect customer experience, product ...
process throughput & quality within the residential energy business. By
using data and reporting metrics to identify potential problems, you will drive
change across the organization and assist teams in achieving long-term goals.
An ideal candidate is skilled at data analytics, reporting, and data processing
concepts and is naturally motivated to seek out and fix problems in a
methodical way.

title: Letting Data Analyst I, or II - Design Division - Austin, TX
description:
Letting Data Analyst I:

Performs moderately complex data analysis in support of the level letting activities & risk analysis process in the Design division. Work involves conducting detailed analysis, and interpretation to identify high-risk projects, potential replacement projects, and make recommendations to meet level letting criteria. Responsible for using standard statistical tools, methods... and techniques to translate data into actionable insights using data visualization software. Serves as primary coordinator with districts for level letting initiatives & changes. Work requires extensive contact with department staff, management, and external governmental agencies and organizations. Works under general supervision, with limited latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

Letting Data Analyst II:

Performs complex data analysis in support of the level letting activities & risk analysis process in the Design division. Work involves conducting detailed analysis, and interpretation to identify high risk projects, potential replacement projects, and make recommendations to meet level letting criteria. Responsible for using standard statistical tools, methods and techniques to translate data into actionable insights using data visualization software. Serves as primary coordinator with districts for level letting initiatives & changes. Work requires extensive contact with department staff, management, and external governmental agencies and organizations. Works under general supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

Essential Duties:

Letting Data Analyst I:
• Designs, develops, and maintains visualizations and reports utilizing data visualization tools and best practices.
• Interprets results to identify significant differences in data.
• Develops reports, dashboards and interactive visualizations using different components of Tableau software including Tableau desktop, Tableau Prep, and Tableau server.
• Prepares and makes presentations.
• Analyzes reports and dashboards to identify high risk projects and mitigate risk.
• Monitor dashboards and project information for trends and identify business needs.
• Monitors and balances letting process schedule challenges for quality, risk mitigation and successful delivery.
• Develops tools, dashboards, and processes to facilitate the risk mitigation process and competing interests.
• Coordinates with divisions to confirm proposed replacement projects meet level letting criteria.
• Communicates and coordinates with internal stakeholders and senior leaders to implement mitigation plans.
• Plans and coordinates activities associated with the delivery of highly complex business and information analyses, information repositories, and reporting/dashboarding applications.
• Identifies business process improvement initiatives and makes recommendations
• Performs other job responsibilities as assigned.

Letting Data Analyst II:

All of the above and:
• Provides decision makers with options how to level letting; Provides back-up plans for high-risk projects going into letting.
• Provides training to other staff members on the use of systems and dashboards to improve their efficiency.

Minimum Qualifications:

Letting Data Analyst I:

Education:
• Bachelor's degree in a related discipline.
• Relevant work experience may be substituted for degree on a year per year basis. Substitutions for Minimum Qualifications

Experience:
• 2 years data analysis, statistics, compilation, and/or report writing experience; transportation project development.
• Experience can be satisfied by full-time or prorated part-time equivalent.
• Related graduate level education may be substituted for experience on a year per year basis.

Letting Data Analyst II:

Education:
• Bachelor's degree in a related discipline.
• Relevant work experience may be substituted for degree on a year per year basis. Substitutions for Minimum Qualifications

Experience:
• 3 years data analysis, statistics, compilation, and/or report writing experience; transportation project development.
• Experience can be satisfied by full-time or prorated part-time equivalent.
• Related graduate level education may be substituted for experience on a year per year basis.

Licenses and Certifications: Valid driver’s license. This position requires driving a state vehicle.

Competencies:

Letting Data Analyst I, or II:

Extensive knowledge of:
• Data analysis and interpretation
• Business processes and methodologies, data import and export protocols
• Knowledgeable of methods, processes, applications used in the analysis and creation of reports and dashboards.

Expert skill in:
• The use of technical tools such as Excel, Access, SQL and other heavy data analysis
• Developing and presenting reports in multiple formats, including Tableau
• Report writing and design
• Working with streaming data and unstructured data from multiple data sources
• Creating graphical user interfaces, visualizations, mockups, prototypes, and design documents
• Using Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, or Qlik
• Using computers and applicable programs, applications, and systems

Proficient skill in:
• Maintaining effective working relationships with others
• Meeting deadlines
• Analyzing business, technical and managerial problems and developing, recommending and implementing effective solutions
• Maintaining a safe working environment
• Understanding of project management processes, milestones, and funding.
• Determines business needs and technical requirements.

Ability to:
• Communicate effectively
• Analyze data and derive informative conclusions.

Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:
• Sedentary work: Lift up to 10 lbs at a time and occasionally carry files/small tools
• Sitting - prolonged periods of time
• Repetitive Motion-substantial movements of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers
• Close Visual Acuity-work includes data/figures; view a computer screen; extensive reading

Conditions of Employment:

Please click this link to read the standard conditions of employment for all positions: Standard Conditions of Employment (TxDOT)

TxDOT's Design Division is seeking a skilled data analyst to drive insights and optimize operations within our state agency. As a vital member of our team, you'll harness data and tools to improve efficiency in how TxDOT delivers transportation projects. Your role will be pivotal in leveraging data insights to manage monthly lettings effectively, steering us towards meeting ambitious annual targets, and ensuring our agency stays on track to deliver impactful projects. If you're passionate about transforming data into actionable solutions and thrive in a collaborative environment, apply now to accelerate your career with us!

title: Data Analyst
description:
Description

Texas Research Institute (TRI) Austin is seeking a data analyst...

Headquartered in southwest Austin, TX, TRI Austin has been successfully performing research and development for over 45 years. We are a small (~50 employees) company which focuses on developing advanced materials, sensors, nondestructive evaluation techniques, and materials testing. Please visit our website at https://tri-austin.com.

As a data analyst at TRI Austin, you will be responsible for using commercial and in-house developed software toolsets to analyze and manage large scientific and engineering datasets. This may include performing statistical analysis of and interpreting the results of large non-destructive inspection datasets.

From this, you will identify and make recommendations for the improvement of the existing software base and analytics used.

In addition to interpretation, the ability to effectively communicate the analysis process and the results are required through writing and presentations.

Other duties are as required. Salary: $75k DOE

title: Data Analyst (Remote)
description:
Who We Are

Texas Workforce Commission connects people with careers across the state. While we are based in the TWC Main Office in Austin on the north lawn of the Texas State Capitol, we have offices statewide and many of our positions are suitable for teleworking. We're a Family Friendly Certified Workplace with great work-life balance, competitive salaries, extensive opportunities for training... and development, and fantastic benefits. This is a remote work position and the person selected must live in Texas and have access to a reliable broadband internet connection.

What You Will Do

Texas Workforce Commission is looking for an experienced Data Analyst I to work on agency wide customer experience data projects for executive leadership. The Data Analyst I will need to learn quickly, value public service, and pursue analytical work to unlock the power of data to improve TWC's services for Texas employers, individuals, families, and communities.

In brief, the Data Analyst I will gather and analyze customer data, using standard statistical tools and methods, to help agency leadership understand and improve our customer service operations. Working with others on the team, you’ll prepare concise technical reports to present and interpret data, identify alternative approaches, and make recommendations for improvement based on your analysis. You will participate in the design and build of data connections between existing databases and customer centered tools.

More Specifically, You Will
• Consults with internal and external customers to identify user needs.
• Compiles and queries data.
• Analyzes data using standard statistical tools, methods, and techniques.
• Interprets results to identify significant differences in data.
• Cleans and prunes data to discard irrelevant information.
• Assists in developing methods to mitigating data issues and deploys those methods to correct issues.
• Assists in preparing technical reports to present and interpret data, identify alternatives, and make and justify recommendations on data revisions.
• Assists in identifying and interpreting data patterns and trends and assessing data quality.
• May assist with establishing and maintaining standard work procedures governing the appropriate use of data.
• Perform other duties as assigned.

You Are a Great Fit With
• Knowledge of statistics and analyzing data sets.
• Experience in running queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
• Experience in record keeping, including security procedures for handling, protecting, and distributing confidential data.
• Ability to conduct data searches; and evaluate and translate large amounts of data.
• Skill in the use of computers and applicable software.
• Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing; to analyze various issues; to work under pressure and meet short deadlines.
• Ability to gather, assemble, correlate, and analyze facts; to devise solutions to problems; to prepare concise reports; to develop and evaluate policies and procedures.
• Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a diverse group of individuals.
• Skill in planning, organizing, and coordinating work to effectively meet frequent and/or multiple deadlines; in handling multiple tasks simultaneously and in managing priorities and demands.

You Qualify With
• High school diploma or equivalent.
• Coursework in data science, business analytics, computer science, computer information systems, management information systems, accounting, finance, mathematics, statistics, economics, or a related field is preferred.

You Gain
• A Family Friendly Certified Workplace.
• Telecommuting offered from anywhere within the State of Texas
• Competitive salary: $4,109.79-$4,476.91/month.
• Defined Retirement Benefit Plan.
• Optional 401(k) and 457 accounts.
• Medical Insurance.
• Paid time off, including time for vacation, sick and family care leave.
• Additional benefits for active employees can be found at https://www.ers.texas.gov/Active-Employees/Health-Benefits.

Veterans

Use your military skills to qualify for this position or other jobs! Go to www.texasskillstowork.com to translate your military

work experience and training courses into civilian job terms, qualifications, and skill sets. Also, you can compare this

position to military occupations (MOS) at the Texas State Auditor's Office by pasting this link into your browser: https://hr.sao.texas.gov/Compensation/MilitaryCrosswalk/MOSC_InformationandCommunication.pdf

How To Apply

To be considered, please complete a State of Texas Application for Employment, and apply online at

www.workintexas.com or in Taleo.

Candidates will be expected to complete a pre-interview questionnaire. Also, candidates chosen to interview should expect an in-box exercise as part of that process.

Applicants must be legally authorized to work for ANY employer in the United States. We will not consider applicants that will need sponsorship now or in the future.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

A position utilizing this classification will be designated as security sensitive according to the Texas Labor Code, Section

301.042.

title: Business Data Analyst
company_name: Dornsife College of Letters, Arts and Sciences
description:
The University of Southern California (USC), founded in 1880, is located in the heart of downtown L.A. and is the largest private employer in the City of Los Angeles. As an employee of USC, you will be a part of a world-class research university and a member of the “Trojan Family,” which is comprised of the faculty, students and staff that make the university a great place to work.

As a... community of Dornsife College “we are committed to the creation, preservation, and communication of fundamental knowledge in all its forms…as well as a lifelong passion for learning and a commitment to the betterment of society.” The academic mission of Dornsife College can only be realized to its fullest potential when we build and protect a representative, equitable, inclusive culture of scholarship for students, faculty, and staff. This is not done through initiatives but by embedding these values into the everyday interactions, relationships, policies, and practices of the College. What is required is a seamless integration of the tenets of equity and inclusivity into every facet of academic life. If we want our scholars, staff, and students to be able to give their very best, we must create an academic environment that portends success.

Success is possible when every member of the Dornsife community owns their role as a steward of the culture in which we learn, research, and work; when we believe that it is because of who we are that we are able to do what we do: achieve excellence, together.

Achieving a robust and inclusive academic culture requires more than just the completion of a task, but includes that person’s capacity to contribute positively to the relationships and culture of their office or department. Therefore, any applicant seeking to advance the mission of Dornsife College should also be assessed on their capacities beyond the technical elements of their work, and demonstrate an understanding of their impact on others, and to articulate how they contribute positively to those around them.

The USC Equity Research Institute (ERI) is a research unit headed by Professor Manuel Pastor and situated within the USC Dornsife College of Letters, Arts & Sciences. Founded in 2007, ERI provides forward-looking, actionable research to support community-based organizations, funders, and other stakeholders working towards social, racial, economic, and environmental justice. ERI produces data-driven analysis and rigorous research to inform movements and policy; leads convenings and communications that deepen and broaden our reach into key audiences; engages in strategic collaborations that leverage our strengths for broader impact; and models an effective, sustainable, and racially-just research center. For more information about us and our projects, visit: https://dornsife.usc.edu/ERI

Job Summary

The USC Equity Research Institute is hiring a Business Data Analyst. The Business Data Analyst plays a critical role in analyzing, preparing, and disseminating information that advances justice and equity in Los Angeles, California, and the nation. at ERI, the Business Data Analyst will not only produce rigorous quantitative and qualitative research, but will also help shape the messaging and strategic frameworks that influence public policy, grant making, coalition building, and on-the-ground campaigns. Through conference planning, public presentations, and professional Business Data Analyst will also become part of a network of leading researchers, policy makers, and grassroots organizers dedicated to using data to advance racial, economic, and social justice. The Business Data Analyst may play a leadership role on projects with expertise in one or more ERI subject areas, technical skills, and/or through supervision of students. This is a full-time, grant-funded position.

The Business Data Analyst will require a mix of skills: familiarity with quantitative and qualitative research strategies, an ability to use statistical and GIS software, experience in statistical analysis and testing, and an ability to make all this relevant to communities and organizations. The Business Data Analyst must be familiar with public datasets, particularly Census data; have an ability to conduct basic analyses; and be able to build graphs, maps, and other materials for messaging and communications through reports, presentations, organizing and facilitating convenings, and other forms of dissemination. The Business Data Analyst will also engage in qualitative interview work, coordinate with community-based research partners, engage in report and article writing, and participate in strategic planning/organizational development activities.

The ideal candidate holds a Masters Degree with 3 years direct experience, has a commitment to racial, economic, and social justice and is bilingual/biliterate.

Compensation

The annual base salary range for this position is $79,672 - $81,000. When extending an offer of employment, the University of Southern California considers factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the candidate’s work experience, education/training, key skills, internal peer equity, federal, state, and local laws, contractual stipulations, grant funding, as well as external market and organizational considerations. In addition to those factors, we believe in the importance of pay equity and consider internal departmental equity of our current team members as a part of any final offer.

USC offers excellent benefits, including health benefits for staff and their family with access to the renowned university medical network; eligibility for retirement plans with employer contributions after six months of employment; tuition benefits for staff and their family; free Professional Development classes; central Los Angeles location with easy access to commuter trains, buses and free tram pick up services; discounts to sporting and other campus events, and more.

Required Documents and Additional Information:
• Resume and cover letter required (may be uploaded as one file). Please do not submit your application without these documents.
• Job openings are posted for a minimum of (5) five business days. This job may be removed from posting boards and filled any time after the minimum posting period has ended, so please apply on the same business day if interested.

The University of Southern California is an Equal Opportunity Employer that Values Diversity.

When extending an offer of employment, the University of Southern California considers factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the candidate’s work experience, education/training, key skills, internal peer equity, federal, state and local laws, contractual stipulations, grant funding, as well as external market and organizational considerations.

This is a grant funded position.

• Job openings are posted for a minimum of (5) five business days. This job may be removed from posting boards and filled any time after the minimum posting period has ended, so please apply on the same business day if interested.

Performs other related duties as assigned or requested. The university reserves the right to add or change duties at any time.

The University of Southern California is an Equal Opportunity Employer that Values Diversity.

Minimum Education: Bachelor's degree Minimum Experience: 1 year Minimum Field of Expertise: Proficient PC skills. Working knowledge of databases, spreadsheets, word processing and statistical software programs. Knowledge of business statistics and data analyses techniques. Ability to manage and analyze data. title: Entry level Data Analyst
description:
ENTRY LEVEL DATA ANALYST

Looking for inquisitive and enthusiastic individuals for entry level position of Data Analyst. You use critical and creative thinking along with analytics and data visualization tools to solve problems. You know that companies must navigate complexity with competitive agility. Youve got the academic preparation, foundational skills, and aspirations to help companies turn... disruption into opportunity through strategies that enable them to successfully execute with equal strength across growth, profitability, sustainability, and trust.

The Work
• Kick-start your career in our Strategy Analyst Development Program to learn the latest strategy skills
• Build your network during office events and volunteer opportunities to gain a sense of inclusion and diversity
• Work closely with clients to analyze how their business is working today and how it could be improved for tomorrow
• Partner with your teammates to show support for their projects and lend your knowledge
• Dig in deep to research, analyze data and come up with great recommendations
• Practice sharing your vision with strong presentations and well-written reports
• Use data visualization skills, charts, graphs and other data models to bring your analysis to life

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree with 0-1 yr experience in related field.

Knowledge of SQL/Python

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Open to relocation

title: Data engineer
description:
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below...

Specific activities may change from time to time.
• Designing and implementing scalable and secure data processing pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, and other Azure services.
• Managing and optimizing data storage using Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure SQL Data Warehouse.
• Developing data models and maintaining data architecture to support data analytics and business intelligence reporting.
• Ensuring data quality and consistency through data cleaning, transformation, and integration processes.
• Monitoring and troubleshooting data-related issues within the Azure environment to maintain high availability and performance.
• Collaborating with data scientists, business analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and implement appropriate data solutions.
• Implementing data security measures, including encryption, access controls, and auditing, to protect sensitive information.
• Automating data pipelines and workflows to streamline data ingestion, processing, and distribution tasks.
• Utilizing Azure's analytics services, such as Azure Synapse Analytics, to provide insights and support data-driven decision-making.
• Keeping abreast of the latest Azure features and technologies to enhance data engineering processes and capabilities.
• Documenting data procedures, systems, and architectures to maintain clarity and ensure compliance with regulatory standards.
• Providing guidance and support for data governance, including metadata management, data lineage, and data cataloging.

1. Works with teammates to solve problems and engineer innovative software solutions.

2. Supports systems integration testing (SIT) and user acceptance testing (UAT) for large, complex, cross-functional application initiatives by providing insight to testing teams in order to ensure the appropriate depth of test coverage.

3. Communicates changes in software architecture and resolves escalated issues.

4. Demonstrate an ability to learn and adopt relevant new technologies, tools, methods and processes to leverage in your solutions.

QUALIFICATIONS

Required Qualifications :

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and / or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
• As an Azure Data Engineer, master data integration and ETL tools crucial for seamless data processing. Azure Data Factory stands at the forefront, orchestrating data workflows.
• In-depth knowledge of Azure cloud data solutions, relational databases, ETL / ELT architecture and concepts, data integration concepts and big data concepts
• Proficiency in languages like Python for data manipulation and SQL for database querying, enabling efficient data processing and analysis
• A strong grasp of Microsoft Azure, covering a spectrum of services for seamless deployment, scaling, and management of data solutions, leveraging the power of the cloud
• Participate in cross-functional teams to comprehend project requirements and translate them into technical solutions. Communicate complicated concepts, designs, and progress to both technical and non-technical stakeholders clearly and concisely.
• Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases
• Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.

1. Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, CIS, or related field

2. Three to five years of experience in software development or a related field

3. Three to five years of experience in database technologies

4. Three to five years of experience working on project(s) involving the implementation of solutions applying development life cycles (SDLC)

Preferred Qualifications : :

Any Microsoft Azure Certification

title: Lead Data Engineer (1)
description:
Summary

Cox Enterprises' Integrated Business Technology Team (IBT), the Information Technology function, is currently looking for a Lead Data Engineer to join our Data Analytics team in Atlanta, GA. As the Lead Data Engineer, you will be responsible for new projects, processes, standards, and the continuous improvement of data and analytics solution delivery across customer portfolios, business... partners, and internal initiatives, with an initial focus on Corporate Shared Services. Additionally, as the Lead Data Engineer, you will lead data analytics resources to deliver and support systems that exceed stakeholder needs, solve unique, complex problems, and drive creative resolutions to provide standardized Business Intelligence solutions. You will be recognized as a thought leader and subject matter expert within the IBT Data Analytics Team, having authoritative technical/functional expertise and critical thinking skills to provide complete solutions to source required data from enterprise systems and to configure Business Intelligence platforms to support business/operational data requirements. You will also define, refine, and enforce standards, guidelines, processes, and operational plans for existing and new projects with an innovative approach to address the company's analytical data needs.

As the Lead Data Engineer, you will leverage broad business understanding to align with key stakeholders to determine business and technical requirements to resolve problems with cross-organizational impact. In this role, you will have end-to-end oversight of the solution and will serve as a functional analyst, technical solution designer, developer, and quality assurance provider. As a successful leader, you will collaborate broadly to conduct analysis of business processes, develop user scenarios, negotiate resolutions, and provide solutions to produce an enhanced functional, operational, and business outcome.
With a focus on the support of data democratization, you will work in a matrix environment providing direct leadership to the Data Platforms Data Engineers, as well as technology leadership to our partners/peers in Enterprise Architecture, Software Engineering, Quality Engineering, Data Science, Business Analysis, Enterprise Applications Solutions, and Project Management. Your interactions will span across the entire software development lifecycle using existing and emerging technologies with both technical and business focus. You will also leverage platform knowledge, perform functional analysis, drive effective solution design, and champion quality outcomes for Business Intelligence solutions. Key to your success will be the ability to demonstrate strong leadership, coaching/mentoring, and management skills while working in a customer-focused, solution-oriented, agile environment.
Your background will include hands-on technical and functional experience with Oracle Databases, Data Warehousing, cloud platforms (e.g. Oracle, Azure, Amazon Web Services, Informatica), data integration platforms (e.g. Informatica IDMC, Informatica Power Center, Azure Data Factory), and functional familiarity with Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, and Oracle BI to support stakeholder requirements. Additionally, a background in leading large, complex engagements requiring in-depth data evaluation and critical thinking, demonstrating thought leadership, and utilizing innovative approaches to designing custom database objects and reporting solutions to support business needs will be key to your success. You will rely on application and business process knowledge as well as your prior implementation experience to guide technical design decisions and manage resource allocation to accomplish business objectives. You have a history of independent judgment and decision-making across a large span of influence.
You will directly manage Data Engineers focused on Business Intelligence solutions. Additionally, you will provide guidance, coaching, and training to stakeholders within the business domain.

Responsibilities
• Manage a team of technical Data Engineers focused on Business Intelligence solutions.
• Lead technical Data Engineers on large, complex technology engagements, roadmaps, and strategies requiring in-depth data evaluation and critical thinking.
• Provide expert knowledge of Business Intelligence solutions and Data Warehousing best practices.
• Facilitate and encourage innovative solutions and recommendations through intentional collaboration to drive novel solutions through various approaches.
• Understand Agile software methodology and tools, advocating an iterative mindset as the team prepares for a broad transition to agile.
• Develop an understanding of Cox Enterprises applications and their interdependencies with source applications, customers, and business processes within the areas they support.
• Coordinate at a management level between Enterprise Application Solutions, Enterprise Architecture, Portfolio Leads, Data Engineering, and Data Analytics to ensure team coordination, synergy, and successful project delivery.
• Partner with Portfolio leaders and business users to understand their needs and develop innovative solution options that balance timelines, scope, complexity, and cost.
• Work closely with BI Architects and Data/Software Engineers to estimate levels of effort for platform changes and review with the business community to set priorities.
• Help prepare requirements documents, functional and technical designs, test scenarios, and deployment plans related to the data platforms.
• Perform gap analysis related to data processes and database table structures that populate reporting and analytics requirements.
• Construct, manage, monitor, and support data integration between multiple systems.
• Learn, understand, and apply Cox enterprise architecture to ensure the proper use of applications, platforms, patterns, technology stacks, technologies, etc.
• Identify architectural issues and propose alternative solutions.
• Incorporate vision as well as practicality in developing future state designs.
• Develop a deep understanding of business needs and how technology solutions impact current and future business processes and controls.
• Perform work within an Agile development team and foster a team mindset with all delivery team members to work toward shared goals and objectives.
• Understand software development languages, including SQL and PL/SQL. Able to convey limitations of individual technologies and recommend solutions based on that understanding.
• Interact and build trusted relationships with all levels of personnel, including management, from both the business and technology teams.
• Know how to identify and mitigate risks and escalate potential business issues.

Qualifications- Experience:
• Bachelor’s degree in a related discipline and 6 years’ experience in a related field. The right candidate could also have a different combination, such as a master’s degree and 4 years’ experience; a Ph.D. and 1 year of experience; or 10 years’ experience in a related field
• At least six years of experience in a complex Enterprise Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence/ Data Analytics development environment. Data Warehousing: Kimball methodology.
• Demonstrated technology leadership to produce results in a large, complex multi-application environment.
• Experience leading code development, test plans, test data, and expected results at a program level.
• Experience in application design and implementation, distributed architecture and concepts, data manipulation and analysis using PL/SQL and SQL.
• Proven track record of deploying large-scale Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence systems.
• Experience with leading teams utilizing: Informatica: Informatica Cloud (IDMC) / Power Center / Master Data Management (MDM); Data Quality (IDQ); Data Catalog Solutions
• Experience working with platforms/systems such as: Oracle eBusiness Suite, Workday Human Capital Management or equivalent (Peoplesoft, Oracle HCM)
• Knowledgeable in areas of business analysis, including requirements planning, management, elicitation, communication, documentation, and solution validation. Understanding of Agile Software Development methodology

title: Geospatial Data Analyst
description:
Description

You are an experienced analyst who is energized by supporting the development of an analytics driven product pipeline for a large and dynamic natural resource-based organization. You have a high attention to detail but are good at seeing the big picture and aren’t afraid to think outside the box. You are effective at communicating timely and relevant information to business... customers. You are passionate about the sustainable role of forests, by acquiring in-depth understanding achieved through supporting and participating in advanced large-scale analysis.

We are a fast-moving team who is responsible for using evidence-based analytics to assess existing strategies, evaluate risks and opportunities, recommend revised or new strategies, evaluate competing business priorities, and provide recommendations on strategic direction to Weyerhaeuser’s Corporate Development Leadership team.

In this role, you will provide analytical support for the company’s best-in-class portfolio analytics technology platform that leverages earth observation data together with geo-spatial biological and physical data, business data, and market information to develop strategic planning tools and recommendations. The successful candidate must have experience compiling, cleaning, sampling and testing large data sets.

This role will be part of the Portfolio Analytics team and will be based in Seattle, WA.

Geospatial Data Analyst Responsibilities:
• Support data science efforts in a fast-paced team environment to accelerate our efforts of building out our analytics driven product pipeline.
• Support the data scientist(s) by sourcing, compiling, and integrating different data sources to ensure consistency and compatibility for analysis, while also handling data cleaning, preprocessing, sampling, and conducting testing and validation using statistical analysis methods, particularly Python.
• Assist the data scientist(s) in the design and execution of algorithms for domain-specific tasks.
• Assist in the development or customization of tools, scripts, or software to automate and optimize data processing and analysis tasks.
• Translate existing tools and workflows into reusable Python scripts.
• Build cross-functional relationships to collaboratively partner within our business, data science team and IT.
• Proactively identify ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality.
• Support the development of communicative and impactful reports on model inputs, model outputs, business impact and key performance indicators.
• Document processes, methodologies, and findings to ensure reproducibility and clarity for other team members.
• Support large geospatial dataset collection, including QA/QC and format standardization.
• Follow standard Weyerhaeuser best practices in managing geospatial data and source code.
• Support the development and presentation of compelling, validated stories to all levels of our organization, including peers, senior management, and internal customers, that communicate the value of earth observation (EO) analytics to drive strategic business initiatives.

Qualifications

Experience: We place an emphasis on what prior experience our candidates bring to the table. This role typically requires a minimum of 3-4 years of prior experience working with large geo-temporal data sets, including EO imagery (Landsat, Sentinel, aerial photos).

Education: You have a bachelor’s degree or higher in a related field with a quantitative emphasis such as Computer Science, Statistics, Resource Economics, Business, Biology, Geospatial data science, or Forestry. Master’s degree preferred.

Skills: To be successful in this role, you understand machine learning concepts and possess strong communication skills with the ability to excite business leaders on the utility of these analytic tools for strategic business decision making. You are a passionate and creative problem solver and are coachable and committed to expanding knowledge and skills.

Technical Requirements: We need an individual who has a strong working knowledge in Microsoft office products (Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI), as well as proficiency in programming environment and languages, specifically Python and R. You’ll need knowledge of analytic and visualization packages available for those languages. You’ll need GIS skills (e.g., ArcGIS). You’ll also need experience with data structures such as Numpy, Pandas and Geopandas, and familiarity utilizing open-source Python analytic libraries such as: SciKit Learn, SciPy. You’ll need cloud computing experience, preferably in the AWS environment.

Highly Valued:
• Forest industry operational experience
• Proficiency in multiple statistical and data management packages
• Exposure to Xarray data structure, parallelization tools Dask.
• Exposure to machine learning and deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras
• Experience with relational and non-relational databases

Our Investment in You: What We Offer

Compensation: This role is eligible for our annual merit-increase program, and we are targeting a salary range of $86,742 to 130,250 based on your level of skills, qualifications, and experience. You will also be eligible for our Annual Incentive Program, which offers a cash bonus targeting 7% of base pay. Potential plan funding may range from zero to two times that target.

Benefits: When you join our team, you and your family will be covered by our comprehensive health benefits plan, which includes medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. We also support personal volunteerism, sponsor a host of diversity networks, promote mentoring, and provide training and development opportunities to help you chart your path to a fulfilling career.

Retirement: Employees can enroll in our company’s 401k plan, which includes a paid company match in addition to our annual contribution equal to 5% of your base salary.

Paid Time Off or Vacation: We provide eligible employees who are scheduled to work 25 hours or more per week with paid vacation for up to 3 weeks to use during your first year of employment. In addition, after being employed for six months, eligible employees begin to accrue vacation for future use. We also recognize eleven paid holidays per year, providing a total of 88 hours along with paid parental leave for all full-time employees.

About Weyerhaeuser: We sustainably manage forests and manufacture products that make the world a better place. We’re serious about safety, driven to achieve excellence, and proud of what we do. With multiple business lines in locations across North America, we offer a range of exciting career opportunities for smart, talented people who are passionate about making a difference. We know you have a choice in your career. We want you to choose us.

Weyerhaeuser is an equal opportunity employer. Inclusion is one of our five core values and we strive to maintain a culture where all our people feel a sense of belonging, opportunity and shared purpose. We are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce and supporting an equitable and inclusive environment that inspires people of all backgrounds to join, stay and thrive with our team.

title: Data Analyst
description:
About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented... opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. You will work with some of Stripe’s most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives. We have a variety of Data Analytics roles and teams across Stripe and will seek to align you to the most relevant team based on your background.

What you'll do

In this role, you will partner deeply with teams across Stripe to ensure that our users, our products, and our business have the models, data products, and insights needed to make decisions and grow responsibly. You will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe's rich and complex data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. You will build metrics, scalable data pipelines, dashboards, and reports to inform and run the business. You will deliver actionable business recommendations through analyses and data storytelling.

Who you are

We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements
• 2-8+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Analysis or Data Science roles, building data pipelines and analyzing large datasets to solve problems
• Proficiency in SQL and Python
• Strong statistical knowledge
• Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
• Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
• Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
• Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights.

Preferred Qualifications
• Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related technical field.
• Prior experience at a growth stage internet or software company.
• Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
• Good understanding of development processes and best practices like engineering standards, code reviews, and testing.

Hybrid work at Stripe

This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office).

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual US base salary range for this role is $146,900 - $220,300. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings ("OTE") range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate’s experience, qualifications, and location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the US may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Additional benefits for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; 401(k) plan; medical, dental, and vision benefits; and wellness stipends

title: Data Analyst 3 - Supply Chain & Insights Team (Hybrid - Seattle)
description:
Job Description

Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (Data Analyst) of the NAP Supply Chain and Insights Team will own the collection and delivery of data and insights for Nordstrom’s Supply Chain and Inventory Organization. This role will provide ongoing data support, performance analysis and storytelling, which will lead to value creation to optimize how we serve customers and stores across... the Nordstrom businesses by helping drive the Inventory and Supply Chain vision. This role is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and presenting data to improve decision making around Supply Chain and Inventory problems. This individual should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. They should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.

A day in the life…
• Develop end to end advanced dashboard resources. Utilizes a combination of visualization techniques to convey information & implements advanced calculations and statistical measures (e.g., LOD, rank, percentile, outlier detection). Efficiently uses dashboard real estate to tell a meaningful story.
• Complete ambiguous projects independently & demonstrate clear understanding of how projects tie to team mission & actively contributes to development of team roadmap.
• Produce analysis & reporting that opens additional strategic questions/opportunities. Identifies opportunities for high-impact data products that align with stakeholder objectives and delivers them in a production environment.
• Prioritize troubleshooting, bubble up key questions to address, root cause analysis, and make smart decisions regarding trade-offs for analyses.
• Maintain complex dashboards that adhere to platform standards & are performant.
• Provide user feedback on Nordstrom Analytical Platform (NAP) for product releases, identify product improvements through analysis, and help drive the strategy for data models using analysis expertise.
• Provide exceptional customer service through professionalism, ownership, and initiative.
• Demonstrate productivity through the efficient use of time and a commitment to strong results.
• Ensure data quality, governance, and master data management across systems.

You own this if you have…
• Quantitative degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering, or similar quantitative analytics discipline
• 3+ years of experience as a data analyst applying advanced data visualization techniques to deliver insights that drive decisions and actions, preferably in supply chain/logistics domain.
• 3+ year of corporate experience writing SQL queries from scratch.
• Able to work independently to translate business questions and objectives into meaningful insights.
• Knowledge of best practice for data consumption, aggregation & ingestion with leading visualization tools (Lookr, Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
• Expert in SQL with knowledge of advanced functions & optimal structures across different databases. Writes performant code and independently productionalizes SQL scripts.
• Comfortable with consulting with data producers on schemas
• Has strong understanding of Supply Chain and Inventory domain, processes, data sources, and key metrics relevant to context. Functions as expert on data sources within domain.
• Familiarity with data modeling nice to have
• Working understanding of statistics

We’ve got you covered…

Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:
• Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away
• Life Insurance and Disability
• Merchandise Discount and EAP Resources

A few more important points...

The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this job.

Nordstrom will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

Applicants with disabilities who require assistance or accommodation should contact the nearest Nordstrom location, which can be identified at www.nordstrom.com.

© 2022 Nordstrom, Inc

Current Nordstrom employees: To apply, log into Workday, click the Careers button and then click Find Jobs.

Pay Range Details

The pay range(s) below are provided in compliance with state specific laws. Pay ranges may be different in other locations.

Washington: $89,000 - $170,500 Annually

This position may be eligible for performance-based incentives/bonuses. Benefits include 401k, medical/vision/dental/life/disability insurance options, PTO accruals, Holidays, and more. Eligibility requirements may apply based on location, job level, classification, and length of employment. Learn more in the Nordstrom Benefits Overview by copying and pasting the following URL into your browser: https://careers.nordstrom.com/pdfs/Ben_Overview_16.pdf

title: Data Analyst II
description:
This position is a hybrid role requiring employees to work from our headquarters location in Seattle, WA every Tuesday and Wednesday, and remote all other days.

Redfin is redefining real estate in the consumer’s favor by combining our own technology and agents to create a service that’s better, faster, and costs less. As a Redfinnian, you'll make a difference in one of life’s most important... events—buying or selling a home. Our hiring standards are high, yet our culture is humble. No matter what role you have, you’ll be both challenged and inspired every day. We’ve got all the perks, but if what you value most is doing great work in a creative, collaborative, and disciplined environment, join us.

As a Data Analyst for the Marketing Analytics team, you’ll help Marketing fuel Redfin’s growth by profitably bringing in potential customers. You’ll analyze traffic and user data, and develop systems that optimize and report on marketing channels’ performance. You'll partner with marketing and engineering to utilize data to shape Redfin's marketing strategy, and drive key business decisions for multi-million dollar investments that help Redfin win. You’ll show the world that we’re offering a better way to find a home.

The Role
• Partner with Redfin’s Marketing teams to take ownership for the success of the marketing campaigns and channels
• Dive deep into Redfin’s data and help make big and crucial decisions about how to use our marketing firepower as efficiently as we can to help Redfin grow as fast as we can
• Continue development and provide ongoing support for the Multi-Touch-Attribution model
• Contribute your opinions on complex projects to a collegial decision making process
• Deliver presentations of your findings and your proposals to the team, management, and the C-level executive team

Who You Are
• 2+ years working in an analytical role in a business context is required. Experience in analytics of operations, especially involving contractor management, performance metrics, and/or customer routing is a plus.
• Advanced SQL and Excel skills.
• Experience using data visualization/BI software (Tableau, Power BI) is required. Specifically, Tableau experience is a plus.
• Ability to design analyses and experiments that produce actionable results fast
• Ability to navigate ambiguity well in projects
• Skill in data storytelling with the ability to explain complex insights clearly and effectively to a less technical audience
• Strong consultative and influencing skills to help leaders make decisions and move the business forward
• Possessing a curiosity that doesn’t stop at the “What?” but hungers for the “Why?” and “What if?”
• Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Economics, Business Analytics, an experimental science, or a related field. An advanced degree in a relevant field is a plus.

The compensation information is provided in compliance with job posting disclosure requirements in Hawaii, Colorado, New York, New Jersey, Washington, and California.

Base Pay Range: $73,800.00 - 110,500.00. Actual base pay will depend on varying circumstances, including the position, location, individual qualifications, market finances, and other operational business needs. Depending on the position, compensation may also include commissions, bonuses, and equity. Potential for merit increases and stock grants based on performance.

Redfin offers a generous benefits package that includes 15 paid vacation days, 12 paid holidays, paid parental leave, sick leave, and flex days; medical, dental, and vision insurance benefits; flexible spending account, health savings account, life and disability insurance; fertility benefits, commuter benefits, Employee Assistance Programs; and 401(k) employer match.

#LI-Hybrid
Redfin is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce.

A diverse, inclusive culture is vital to Redfin's mission of making real estate better for people from all walks of life. We’re proud that Redfin is a place where different points of view and backgrounds are encouraged and respected. We constantly strive to build a company that reflects the world around us, based on our conviction that pursuing and developing talent of all types is the right way for a business to thrive over the long haul.

title: Generative AI Engineer
description:
We are looking for a AI/ML Engineer to join a small team of ambitious people that are building an AI-powered assistant product in the Palo Alto, CA. We build innovative solutions that aim to amplify the power of our users through intelligent interactions. This position is ideal for a talented expert eager to apply their skills in the production of highly practical tools, advancing our AI... Assistant products and solutions through innovative technology. This role is not research-based but rather focused on applying your theoretical knowledge and expertise directly into work going into the product, transforming theory into practice. The output of this position is customer facing and will be in everyday use by those who will come to depend on it.

This job requires continuous on-site work in Palo Alto, CA

Responsibilities:
• Develop innovative solutions and models based on Large Language Models and Natural Language Processing to enhance understanding and generation of natural language in our AI Assistant products.
• Stay on top of the current research in using LLM, and translate complex theoretical ideas into practical solutions for direct product implementations.

• Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills.
• Ability to work collaboratively in a team and communicate complex ideas effectively.

• Proficiency in handling and manipulating large datasets
