title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Company Description

ABOUT...

A subsidiary of Veolia group, Veolia North America (VNA) offers a full spectrum of water, waste and energy management services, including water and wastewater treatment, commercial and hazardous waste collection and disposal, energy consulting and resource recovery. VNA helps commercial, industrial, healthcare, higher education and municipality customers throughout North America. Headquartered in Boston, Mass., Veolia North America has more than 10,000 employees working at more than 350 locations across the continent. Please visit our website www.veolianorthamerica.com

Job Description

BENEFITS

Veolia's comprehensive benefits package includes paid time off policies, as well as health, dental and vision insurance. In addition, employees are also entitled to participate in an employer sponsored 401(k) plan, to save for retirement. Pay and benefits for employees represented by a union are outlined in their collective bargaining agreement.

POSITION PURPOSE: The primary role is to provide reporting and analytics by documenting and analyzing business requirements, developing solutions, and supporting the feasibility studies for projects of various scope and complexity in support of Veolia’s Information Technology strategy.

The position manages the requirements development process through the elicitation, analysis, specification, and verification of multi-level requirements from business partners and supports the ongoing management of the requirements in a cost-effective way. Through strong interpersonal skills and exceptional business understanding, s/he will build trust with business partners to help elevate business and technical requirements through excellent business writing and SDLC methodologies.

Incumbents for this position will have the opportunity to work on two different career paths:

Technical Path – Develop and executive a technical specification document summarizing the business requirements. Focus on the development, delivery and management of Business Intelligence reports and Dashboards utilizing the best technical solution.

Customer Facing Role - Act as a liaison between business partners and the IT team. S/he understands the business requirements and business process management, and then translates them to software/reporting requirements.

PRIMARY DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Develop customized reporting in Tableau and Telerik using energy data and a variety of other data sources.
• Gathering and consolidating data from varied sources
• Influence and guide energy reporting strategy by collecting customer feedback and providing insights to internal stakeholders.
• Lead customer workshops to collect feedback and guide custom report design.
• Actively optimize and improve Tableau server performance in conjunction with vendor and internal develops resources.
• Fielding inquiry requests and managing problem resolution for customer energy monitoring issues.
• Collect and organize various energy data sources, develop analysis into processes and code using various tools such as Excel, VBA, MS Access, SQL, and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), and improve existing processes.

Qualifications

Education / Experience / Background
• BS/BA in Business, Mathematics, Engineering or related discipline
• Data Analytics certification preferred.
• 2+ years of Tableau experience required.
• Advanced SQL skills required.
• Telerik reporting experience preferred.
• Energy related experience preferred.
• Advanced PC and Microsoft Office skills.
• Strong analytical/problem solving skills required.
• Languages: R, Python, or MATLAB preferred.
• Attention to details and ability to review materials for accuracy.
• Strong oral and written communication skills.
• Ability/flexibility to learn and apply new skills.
• High level of professionalism and integrity.

Additional Information

DISCLAIMER:

We are an equal opportunity employer! All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Disclaimer: The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. The Company reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law

title: Business Intelligence Systems Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Systems Analyst

About the Opportunity...

JOB SUMMARY

The Division of Information Services is currently seeking a talented individual to fill the role of Business Intelligence Systems Analyst. The Business Intelligence Systems Analyst will be a dedicated member of the Business Intelligence & Analytics team responsible for ongoing growth and development of the University's bi-modal Snowflake cloud data platform and enterprise data warehouse capabilities.

Under the direction of the Director of Business Intelligence & Analytics, the incumbent will work closely with business partners and the Data Administration team to gather functional requirements and translate them into technical specifications used in the design, development, and deployment of Business Intelligence applications, reports, and data assets.

The candidate will be expected to develop a solid foundational understanding of the key business concepts and drivers followed by functional organizations within the University. The Business Intelligence Systems Analyst will work closely with Data Architects and Engineers to utilize conceptual and physical data modeling techniques that define the data platform and enterprise data warehouse environments.

Additionally, the Business Intelligence Systems Analyst will be closely involved in other aspects of the University's business intelligence function, including source system profiling and data transformation design; design and development of BI content (e.g., static & dynamic reports, dashboards, data files, etc.); metadata documentation; and user support and training.

To ensure that essential services are provided to the university community, the employee will be required to work outside his/her regular working hours and on some university holidays. This is a remote position that does not require the candidate to work on site.

At Team ITS, your success matters as much as the mission. Learn more about our flexible, highly dynamic, and values-first culture at careers.its.northeastern.edu.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
• The ideal candidate will hold a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics or related and 5+ years working in a business intelligence function
• Experience working with modern SaaS cloud data platforms such as Snowflake, AWS, or Google
• Advanced understanding of SQL query language required
• Working experience with data integration & transformation procedures to load data from transactional systems into data platforms, lakes, warehouses
• Experience with design and creation of operational and analytical reports and dashboards for end users. Understanding of data warehouse best practices and methodologies, including Kimball, Inmon, etc.
• Experience with one or more industry leading BI applications such as Cognos, Tableau, or PowerBI required
• Prior experience with ETL/ELT tools such as IICS, PowerCenter, Matillion, Databricks, etc. a plus
• Understanding of data visualization techniques (e.g., Few, Tufte, etc.) a plus
• Experience effectively interacting with end-users, partners or customers required along with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• A sense of urgency to address client requests effectively and quickly
• Ability to work independently and be on-call when needed

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

Analyze Client Requests for Project / Work Initiation 35%

Clarifies understanding of business/technical requests. Identifies and evaluates alternative business intelligence and reporting solutions. Works with the Director of Business Intelligence & Analytics to prepare high level documentation that identifies viable options to address reporting/analytic needs. Works with appropriate parties to gain approval of proposal and initiate work. Collaborates with appropriate functional/technical staff (e.g., Data Architects, BI Developers, Business Analysts, etc.) to prepare and document project-planning information (e.g., time, resources, major tasks required to complete work) for input into the scoping documentation.

Document Business Requirements and Prepare Detail Design Specifications 30%

Facilitates and/or partners with Data Administration and other business/technical staff to facilitate a systematic process for capturing detailed business functional and technical requirements (e.g., via JAD session, etc.). Works with business/technical partner to capture requirements in a standard format that will serve as the foundation for the creation of technical documentation (e.g., business intelligence application technical requirements, input and output requirements, ETL/interfaces, design specification, test strategies and plans, etc.). Works with Business Intelligence & Analytics team and other business/technical staff to determine system components and functional flow of components and data between components. Assist in source definition for the cloud data platform and data warehouse attributes. Map attributes to source including identification and documentation of transformation algorithms as necessary. Document findings in the metadata repository. Creates detailed business intelligence program specifications from which a developer can code. Validates the design documentation with the appropriate parties and receives approval on these documents. Reviews final design documents with Business Intelligence & Analytics team to ensure that they thoroughly understand the work requested of them.

Manage Informatics Project Implementation 10%

May serve as, project manager or coordinate with assigned IS project manager for business intelligence and reporting projects/programs whose scope and duration range from small to large. Works with internal customers to identify the issue or request, and then identifies and collaborates with Data Administration and technical team to design business intelligence or reporting solutions that meets the business need(s). Involves appropriate parties as needed to complete the work. Ensures delivered business intelligence solutions meet customer requirements, expectations and needs.

Assist in Testing New or Upgraded Informatics System Solutions 15%

Verifies acceptance testing at the business intelligence system level. Works with appropriate parties to complete accurate and thorough test plans on new / upgraded functionality. Reviews test results for any business intelligence system modifications. Resolves issues uncovered during testing.

Provide Leadership / Direction / Consultation to Business Intelligence & Analytics Team 10%

Works with business and technical teams to maintain or build business intelligence and reporting systems and clarifies design expectations as necessary. Respond to business and technical questions. Researches and involves appropriate parties to resolve more complex business intelligence and technical issues. Monitors progress of work to ensure that design requirements are met. Collaborate with other IT BI team members in the development and implementation of standards, policies, and best practices in the development and maintenance of the business intelligence systems. Provides management with timely and appropriate status updates on the work performed by the team and any barriers that have been encountered.

Position Type

Information Technology

Additional Information

Northeastern University is an equal opportunity employer, seeking to recruit and support a broadly diverse community of faculty and staff. Northeastern values and celebrates diversity in all its forms and strives to foster an inclusive culture built on respect that affirms inter-group relations and builds cohesion.

All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

To learn more about Northeastern University's commitment and support of diversity and inclusion, please see www.northeastern.edu/diversity.

To apply, visit [Link available when viewing the job] />

description:

title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Consultant
description:
The Opportunity

As the Business Intelligence & Analytics Consultant, you’ll work directly with the Head of Advice & Financial Planning to develop reporting capabilities to help grow Financial Planning’s footprint in the field. You’ll work towards installing Practice Management capabilities that drive High Net Worth Client Acquisition, Net Flows, and growth through Practice Efficiencies. In... addition, Practice Acquisition and Transition support processes will be enhanced to help grow and retain the Net Field Force.

The Team

You’ll work with a high performing team focused on enhancing the advisor and client experience to drive business results through Financial Planning, Practice Management, and Experienced Advisor onboarding leading the way for organic and inorganic advisor growth. The team is comprised of industry experts in Financial Planning, Tools and Platform design, Policy, Data Science and Sales.

The Impact:

Align with the Business Intelligence and Analytics Team Lead on key priorities:
• Responsible for analysis and problem solving as relates to data, types of data, and relationships among data elements within a business system.
• Produce/deliver results through Business Intelligence tools. With general guidance responsible for the collection, organization, analysis and dissemination of significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
• Perform single source data extracts with simple data transformations.
• Interpret requirements into meaningful insights.
• Identification/development of key performance indicators applicable to analysis.
• Profile, categorize, and analyze quality of data. Derive meaningful insights through visualizations.
• Monitor and organize all field and team requests and perform all timely assessment for all data/analysis requests.
• Develop presentation materials, and meeting collateral for Advice & Financial Planning leadership team.
• Design visual representations and report strategic connectivity to department and enterprise goals and objectives.
• Visualize data for the organization.
• Consult while providing directional guidance to data users.
• Perform reporting and system testing related to system enhancements in scheduled timeframes.

The Minimum Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree or H.S. diploma and 5+ years of business analytics experience.
• 3 years of experience in client-facing analytics, strategy consulting, or financial analysis.
• 1+ year of SQL or related data querying tool experience
• 1+ year of experience manipulating and working with large amounts of information
• 1+ year of experience with Microsoft Excel
• Due to the nature of this position, as a part of our background check process, candidates must be able to pass a non-registered fingerprint background check to qualify as a fingerprinted person under FINRA

The Ideal Qualifications
• Experience working with clients, advising on marketing/business performance, and influencing decisions with insights and measurement.
• Ability to analyze datasets, identify actionable insights, and communicate findings via presentations and/or dashboards.
• Ability to present simple and compelling stories to audiences of all levels.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Salesforce Experience
• Tableau and/or SAS software experience
• Excel VBA experience

What to Expect as Part of MassMutual and the Team
• Regular meetings with the Business Intelligence and Analytics Team Lead
• Focused one-on-one meetings with your manager
• Access to mentorship opportunities
• Networking opportunities including access to Asian, Hispanic/Latinx, African American, women, LGBTQ, veteran, and disability-focused Business Resource Groups
• Access to learning content on Degreed and other informational platforms.
• Your ethics and integrity will be valued by a company with a strong and stable ethical business with industry leading pay and benefits.

#LI-BC1

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Company Overview

Every firm has a culture - the values, beliefs, methodology, attitudes and standards that reflect an organization's DNA. But the truly inspiring firms - the game-changers, the industry leaders and the disruptors - have cultures that propel them to innovate and stand out. At Brown Advisory, we aim to be one of those inspired firms. Over the years, we have purposefully built and... nurtured our client-first culture.

Brown Advisory is an independent investment management and strategic advisory firm committed to delivering a combination of first-class performance, strategic advice and the highest level of client service with offices in Austin, Baltimore, Boston, Delaware, Frankfurt, London, Nashville, New York, North Carolina, San Francisco, Singapore, Southern California, Tokyo, Virginia and Washington, D.C. The firm's institutional and private clients are based in 50 states and more than 44 countries and territories and are served by over 850 colleagues worldwide, all of whom are equity owners of the firm.

Position Summary

Brown Advisory provides applicants with a client-first, fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where they will have the opportunity to develop their problem-solving skills with the support of dedicated teammates. Our team takes great care to ensure that the needs of our stakeholders are met and their expectations are exceeded. The Reporting & Business Intelligence Team is currently seeking a dynamic individual to drive change and solve complex challenges by utilizing data as a Business Intelligence Analyst.

Essential Functions/Responsibilities:
• Generate monthly, quarterly, and ad-hoc reports for our private client and institutional relationships
• Produce custom business-segment and/or firm analytics for managerial reporting on a regular or ad-hoc basis
• Develop, communicate, and/or expound reports and analysis for internal and external stakeholders
• Troubleshoot any reporting or operational process errors, then propose and implement solutions
• Manage projects to create or improve reporting content and/or advance strategic business goals
• Support client use of TouchPoint, the firm's proprietary online client-access portal
• Provide support, innovation, and project consultation for multiple business segments
• Develop industry insights through proactive networking, conference attendance, and independent research
• Analyze and interpret relevant investment data, including portfolio positions, transactions, and performance

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree required
• Superior analytical and problem solving skills
• Experience with Microsoft Excel (VBA preferred)
• Superior written and oral communication skills
• Highly organized and detail-oriented
• Diligent work ethic
• Experience working in a team environment
• Proactive mentality
• Ability to adapt in a positive manner to rapidly changing priorities
• Ability to remain calm in a fast paced environment
• Ability to handle confidential material with utmost discretion
• Interested applicants must conduct themselves in a highly professional manner
• Knowledge of Advent Software or other portfolio management systems preferred
• Knowledge of FactSet/Bloomberg/MPI/Tableau preferred
• Ability to work in an office location

Benefits

At Brown Advisory we offer a competitive compensation package, including full benefits.

Corporate gym membership discounts

title: Business Intelligence Analyst II, Transportation
description:
If you are looking for a career at a dynamic company with a people-first mindset and a deep culture of growth and autonomy, ACV is the right place for you! Competitive compensation packages and learning and development opportunities, ACV has what you need to advance to the next level in your career. We will continue to raise the bar every day by investing in our people and technology to help our... customers succeed. We hire people who share our passion, bring innovative ideas to the table, and enjoy a collaborative atmosphere.

Who we are:

ACV is a technology company that has revolutionized how dealers buy and sell cars online. We are transforming the automotive industry. ACV Auctions Inc. (ACV), has applied innovation and user-designed, data driven applications and solutions. We are building the most trusted and efficient digital marketplace with datasolutions for sourcing, selling and managing used vehicles with transparency and comprehensive insights that were once unimaginable. We are disruptors of the industry and we wantyou to join us on our journey. ACV’s network of brands includes ACV Auctions, ACV Transportation, ClearCar, MAX Digital and ACV Capital within its Marketplace Products, as well as, True360 and Data Services.

At ACV we focus on the Health, Physical, Financial, Social and Emotional Wellness of our Teammates and to support this we offer:
• Multiple medical plans including a high deductible health plan that costs $0 out of your paycheck
• Company-sponsored (paid) Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, and Life Insurance
• Comprehensive optional benefits such as Dental, Vision, Supplemental Life/AD&D, Legal/ID Protection, and Accident and Critical Illness Insurance
• Generous paid time off options, including vacation time, sick days, Company holidays, floating holidays, parental leave, bereavement leave, jury duty leave, voting leave, and other forms of paid leave as required by applicable law or regulation
• Employee Stock Purchase Program with additional opportunities to earn stock in the Company
• Retirement planning through the Company’s 401(k)

Who we are looking for:

The Analyst II, Business Intelligence is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to provide actionable insights and support strategic decision-making within the ACV Transportation business. This role will be responsible for requirements gathering, report building, QA, and impact analysis. The Analyst II, Business Intelligence role partners with the Business Intelligence Manager, Transportation leadership team, and peers who are subject matter experts in their respective business areas to enhance operational efficiency, identify growth opportunities, and drive business success.

What you will do:
• Actively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience.
• Create and expand reporting of KPIs for the Transportation business through dashboards and data visualizations.
• Utilize business intelligence tools (i.e., Tableau, Power BI, etc.) to communicate key metrics, KPIs, and performance indicators to stakeholders.
• Build robust and scalable tools and dashboards to monitor business outcomes and workflows.
• Develop insights that enable dealer and carrier segmentation.
• Identify and investigate opportunities to improve team efficiency through performance tracking and trend analysis.
• Impact assessment of Transportation business in collaboration with the Product & Technology roadmap prioritization and grooming
• Continuously identify opportunities to streamline and automate data collection, analysis, and reporting processes. Implement efficient methodologies and tools to enhance data quality, accuracy, and accessibility.
• Collaborate with Marketing to support marketing initiatives surrounding the ACV Transportation business.
• Perform additional duties as assigned.

What you will need:
• Bachelor’s degree in related field required.
• 2-5 years’ related professional experience, with a focus on data analysis, reporting, and visualization.
• Ability to read, write, speak, and understand English.
• Experience with data visualization / dashboarding tools (Tableau experience preferred)
• Familiarity with business technology (GSuite preferred)
• Developing understanding of agile or iterative development
• Ability to design and apply logical QA tests to technical solutions.
• Demonstrated passion for helping people by providing technology-based solutions to their business needs
• A reliable self-starter attitude that can thrive in an entrepreneurial environment.
• Willing to navigate and connect with multiple stakeholders and departments.
• A keen interest in continuous skill development.
• Demonstrated technical writing skills.
• Analytical thinking and problem-solving ability.
• Demonstrated communication and organizational skills.

No immigration or work visa sponsorship will be provided for this position.

#LI-AM3

Our Values

Trust & Transparency | People First | Positive Experiences | Calm Persistence | Never Settling

At ACV, we are committed to an inclusive culture in which every individual is welcomed and empowered to celebrate their true selves. We achieve this by fostering a work environment of acceptance and understanding that is free from discrimination. ACV is committed to being an equal opportunity employer regardless of sex, race, creed, color, religion, marital status, national origin, age, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, disability, military status, status as a veteran, or any other protected characteristic. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires reasonable accommodation, please let us know.

For information on our collection and use of your personal information, please see our Privacy Notice

title: Business Intelligence/Data Analyst
description:
About Specialty Program Group

Our goal is to partner with industry-leading specialty businesses to provide them with the ability to achieve their goals and optimize their businesses. Specialty Program Group offers access to capital andinvestment, deep carrier relationships, creative thinking, product development and broad distribution, while allowing our businesses to maintain the essence of... what makes them successful. Specialty Program Group delivers leading-edge specialty expertise backed by transformative digital capabilities and sophisticated data and analytics.

About Squaremouth

Squaremouth was launched in 2003 with the core goals of becoming the best workplace for its employees and the best place for customers to buy travel insurance. In 2014, we utilized our travel insurance expertise to develop and launch Tin Leg, a travel insurance brand with policies designed to address our customer’s most common and pressing travel concerns. Tin Leg quickly became one of the most popular travel insurance providers on squaremouth.com and continues to offer some of the most comprehensive products in the travel insurance market.

We’ve grown from a small team to a company of over 50 employees, gaining national and international recognition along the way as one of the best customer service teams and best places to work. Widely recognized for our company culture, we are proud of most recently being named one of the Best Workplaces in America in 2023 by Inc. Magazine!

Continuing to strive toward our goal of being one of the most innovative companies in the field, Squaremouth was acquired in April 2023 by Specialty Program Group (SPG), a leading operator of specialty insurance brokerages and underwriting facilities. Today, Squaremouth.com, and its multi-award winning customer service team, has helped over 3 million travelers save time and money to find the best travel insurance policy for their trip.

Position Summary

Squaremouth's mission is to take complicated insurance products and allow customers to easily compare them to find exactly what they need for peace of mind as they travel away from home.

We are looking for an experienced and motivated Business Intelligence analyst to join our team. We are looking for a team player who can work in a highly collaborative environment. They will teach themselves, learn from others, and take ownership of their successes and challenges. The ideal candidate should have an intrinsic desire for personal growth and professional success.

As the Business Intelligence analyst, you will be a valuable partner to the leadership teams across our company, developing and delivering high-impact, data-driven solutions to support business objectives and operations. You will play an important role in building and improving our data gathering and reporting capabilities, as well as critically assessing and analyzing collected data.

What You Will Do
• Design and develop tools, techniques, metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization
• Examine and identify data patterns and trends to help answer business questions and improve decision making
• Generate cross-functional solutions through the collection, interpretation, evaluation, and analysis of large data sets
• Collaborate with key stakeholders to align data-driven solutions with business strategies and needs
• Work cross-functionally with multiple teams and departments in the company

Experience and skills that are important for success in this position:
• Bachelor's degree (4-year) specialized in a relevant discipline
• 2-4 years of experience in an analytical role
• On-the-job experience with statistical programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL
• Experience with aggregating, transforming, and integrating data from various sources into AWS services for analysis
• Ability to simplify complex technical and statistical information for various leaders and team members across the organization
• Passion for growing your skills, tackling interesting work, and challenging problems
• Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills
• Energetic, positive attitude

It Would Be Great If You Had Experience With
• Building reports using Tableau, Looker, Quicksight or similar BI Tool
• Writing efficient SQL queries for MySQL
• Designing dashboards to effectively communicate performance
• Building documentation around data models to better understand and develop systems for future requirements

Benefits
• Salary range for this position is $75,000 - $100,000 annually, commensurate with experience
• 401(k) match
• Mandatory birthday off with $200 bonus
• Involvement in major Squaremouth decisions
• We are currently full time remote

Disclosure required under applicable state or municipality regulations: The expected salary range for this position is $75,000 - $100,000 and will be impacted by factors such as the successful candidate’s skills, experience and working location, as well as the specific position’s business line, scope and level. HUB International is proud to offer comprehensive benefit and total compensation packages which could include health/dental/vision/life/disability insurance, FSA, HSA and 401(k) accounts, paid-time-off benefits, and eligible bonuses, equity and commissions for some positions.

Department Business Operations

Required Experience: 2-5 years of relevant experience

Required Travel: No Travel Required

Required Education: Bachelor's degree (4-year degree)

HUB International Limited is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer that does not discriminate on the basis of race/ethnicity, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran's status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state or federal laws, rules or regulations. EEOAA Policy

E-Verify Program

We endeavor to make this website accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact the US Recruiting Team toll-free at (844) 300-9193 orUSRecruiting@hubinternational.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only; do not use this contact information to inquire about the status of applications.

Hi, we’re HUB.

In a rapidly changing world, we advise businesses and individuals on how to prepare for the unexpected.

When you partner with us, you're at the center of a vast network of experts who will help you reach your goals through risk services, claims management, and compliance support.

And this gives you the peace of mind that what matters most to you will be protected — through unrelenting advocacy and tailored insurance solutions that put you in control.

About HUB International

Headquartered in Chicago, Illinois, HUB International Limited (HUB) is a leading full-service global insurance broker providing property and casualty, life and health, employee benefits, investment and risk management products and services. From offices located throughout North America, HUB’s vast network of specialists provides peace of mind on what matters most by protecting clients through unrelenting advocacy and tailored insurance solutions. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: LaSalle Network is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who loves to refine data into rich reports and actionable insights. As a member of our team – you’ll work directly with and report to the analytics lead and partner with sales, recruiting and back-office stakeholders. We’re a high energy environment where effort and passion will be met with opportunities for growth and ownership. The right candidate will be someone with business intelligence and data experience. Someone able to translate business into trustworthy reports and dashboards in the day to day – the person will work with our partners to understand the business’ needs and then translate those into data products. The Analytics team is just getting going, so we’re seeking someone who wants to match our growth with theirs. Someone excited about an opportunity to make a mark by defining how we deliver value for the company. Business Intelligence Analyst Responsibilities: - Build and maintain Tableau reporting suite ... Work with internal stakeholders to understand and define reporting requirements and needs - Use analytical tools like SQL and Tableau to dive deep and answer questions - Present insights, metrics and analytics empowering us to make the right decisions - Be a partner to peers and partners Business Intelligence Analyst Requirements: - Experience building measures, metrics and developing reporting solutions - Experience with BI tools, such as Tableau (Preferred), Looker, PowerBI or similar - Experience using SQL to create, transform and access data - Experience working with business stakeholders to translate between data and business needs - Basic understanding of structuring data for analytics (data modelling). - Basic understanding of statistical concepts - Basic understanding of sales or recruiting processes. - Familiarity with R/Python to perform analytics / data modelling If this role interests you, please apply today. Thank you, Kelsey Gonzalez Team Lead LaSalle Network

title: Business Intelligence Analyst, Professional Services
description:
Company Overview:

BE PART OF BUILDING THE FUTURE...

What do NASA and emerging space companies have in common with COVID vaccine R&D teams or with Roblox and the Metaverse?

The answer is data, - all fast moving, fast growing industries rely on data for a competitive edge in their industries. And the most advanced companies are realizing the full data advantage by partnering with Pure Storage. Pure’s vision is to redefine the storage experience and empower innovators by simplifying how people consume and interact with data. With 11,000+ customers including 58% of the Fortune 500, we’ve only scratched the surface of our ambitions.

Pure is blazing trails and setting records:
• For ten straight years, Gartner has named Pure a leader in the Magic Quadrant
• Our customer-first culture and unwavering commitment to innovation have earned us a certified Net Promoter Score in the top 1% of B2B companies globally
• Industry analysts and press applaud Pure’s leadership across these dimensions
• And, our 5,000+ employees are emboldened to make Pure a faster, stronger, smarter company as we go

If you, like us, say “bring it on” to exciting challenges that change the world, we have endless opportunities where you can make your mark.

Position Overview:

The rapidly growing Global Professional Services team is seeking a detail-oriented, collaborative and strategically-minded Business Intelligence (BI) professional to build and evolve our data-driven insights that empower decisions. As this is an emerging function within Professional Services, you will have your chance to make a measurable difference!

In this global role, you will be integral in architecting, building, and optimizing our data infrastructure to support sales and operational analytics and business intelligence. Paired with a Business Analyst teammate, this role requires a blend of skills in data architecture and data analysis to creatively solve complex business problems and accelerate the speed of decision making for our global teams and customers. We operate in a fast-paced, dynamic, global environment and empower our team to thrive in an entrepreneurial culture. This position is ideal for someone looking to make an impact that will help evolve our Global Professional Services organization to the next level of strategic value for our customers.

Responsibilities:

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING...
• Analyze and organize raw data, build data systems, and develop pipelines.
• Utilize SQL scripting from multiple sources to create datasets for visualization.
• Evaluate source application fields and build ETL/ELT integrations into Data Warehouse, ideally with Snaplogic.
• Develop rich, interactive, visually striking graphics and data visualizations using large amounts of data in Tableau and/or other data visualization tools.
• Help scale BI processes using automation and scripting wherever possible.
• Provide insight into leading analytic practices and foster best practices that are consistent with BI design standards.
• Investigate and troubleshoot data-related issues for the business.
• Expand upon existing dashboards and partner internally to continue refining and operationalizing reporting into a more centralized repository and reporting interfaces.
• Support Professional Services in conducting ad hoc data analysis and reporting.
• Partner with business stakeholders and align with one or more functional groups to understand key metrics and document business requirements.
• Help design and document business intelligence strategies, principles, and roadmaps, specifically around Customer Experience (CX) and Professional Services.
• Design business rules to analyze customer data and trigger actions for proactive customer engagement.

Qualifications:

WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO THE TEAM...
• 5+ years of experience with SQL, Python, and data visualization/exploration tools.
• Strong communications skills, able to break down complex problems to an understandable level that builds confidence with stakeholders.
• Bachelor's degree in statistics, computer science, CIS, MIS, or math preferred.
• Validated experience with data visualization and business intelligence tools like Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, etc.
• Understanding of database structures in platforms like SalesForce.com, ServiceNow, and SAP; experience with Snowflake or similar cloud Data Warehouse.
• Strong organizational skills with a high level of accountability and professionalism; self-directed and resourceful.
• Prior exposure to web development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React) is beneficial.
• Experience working within Professional Services is a plus.

Pay Range: USD $119,000.00 - USD $179,000.00 /Yr

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
What We Do

At GoGuardian, we’re helping build a future where all learners are ready and inspired to solve the world’s greatest challenges. Our award-winning system of learning solutions is purpose-built for K-12 and trusted by school leaders to promote effective teaching and equitable engagement while helping empower educators to keep students safe...

What It’s Like to Work at GoGuardian

We are an outcomes-focused learning company with a steadfast focus on improving learning environments, one classroom at a time. Working with us means joining a remote team of diverse, committed, mission-driven employees who are inspired by our vision, dedicated to our customers, and ready to roll up their sleeves. Guardians put their heads together to solve problems, learn together from experiments that fail, and stand together by their work with full accountability. We balance our diligence with an inclusive culture that invites everyone to bring their whole self to work. Join us and learn why “I love the people here” is one of the most frequent comments we hear from Guardians.

Liminex, Inc., dba GoGuardian seeks Business Intelligence Analyst in El Segundo, CA:

Job Duties: Provide tactical and strategic intelligence to business decision-makers (BDMs)
within Sales, Product, Finance, or People teams. Work closely with BDMs to understand their
business intelligence (BI) requirements and assist in defining KPIs and metrics for each
department. Build and manage data analytics products (reports, dashboards, etc.) to monitor
business performance and make data-informed decisions. Provide written and verbal
summaries, conclusions, and recommendations regarding business performance. Alert
decision-makers to changes in business performance, investigate, and attempt to explain these
changes quantitatively. Implement reproducible research principles when building data products.
Work with the data engineering team to prioritize data needs, identify data quality issues, assist
in data modeling, and monitoring of nightly BI-related jobs. Help ensure department software
tools are being used in a manner that results in reliable data collection. Telecommuting is an
option.

Minimum Requirements: Master’s degree, or foreign equivalent, in Computer Science,
Information Technology, or closely related quantitative discipline, and one (1) year of experience
in job offered or in any occupation in a related field.

Special Skill Requirements: (1) Tableau; (2) Data Analytics; (3) SQL; (4) Project Management;
(5) Data visualization; (6) Python; (7) Statistical modeling; (8) ETL Pipelines; and (9) Web App
Development. Any suitable combination of education, training and/or experience is acceptable.
Telecommuting is an option.

Salary: $123,596.40 - $142,135.86 per annum.

Please share this with your friends or co-workers who may be interested in working at GoGuardian! We have multiple openings and are always looking for talented people.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
WellNow Urgent Care is here to help our patients get well. Founded in 2011, we have quickly grown, with over 180 locations across New York, Illinois, Indiana, Ohio and Michigan. Putting people at the heart of everything we do we focus on providing the best care for both our patients and our employees.

WellNow is a part of TAG – The Aspen Group (TAG) is one of the largest and most trusted retail... healthcare business support organizations in the U.S. and supports over 20,000 healthcare professionals and team members at more than 1,300 health and wellness offices across 48 states in four distinct categories: dental care, urgent care, medical aesthetics, and animal health. Working in partnership with independent practice owners and clinicians, the team is united by a single purpose: to prove that healthcare can be better and smarter for everyone. TAG provides a comprehensive suite of centralized business support services that power the impact of five consumer-facing businesses: Aspen Dental, ClearChoice Dental Implant Centers, WellNow Urgent Care, Chapter Aesthetic Studio, and AZPetVet. Each brand has access to a deep community of experts, tools and resources to grow their practices, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-quality consumer healthcare experiences at scale.

The Business Intelligence Analyst is an experienced professional with a passion for preparing and presenting information in a visually appealing and easily understood manner, making it relevant and actionable for key stakeholders. Requires the ability to collect and synthesize complex data from multiple sources, provide intellectual rigor to analysis and interpretation processes, and derive meaningful insights that support the achievement of strategic and operational goals. Acts as a resource to the Executive Leadership Team to support and facilitate the development of self-serve analytics. Maximizes use of the enterprise data warehouse and develops solutions that can be scaled. Enjoys working collaboratively with data and cross-functional teams. Will provide analytic training to other departments.

Responsibilities
• Analyze large datasets to discover trends, patterns and actionable insights.
• Apply research and evaluation standards, descriptive statistics and data management principles to translate complex data into meaningful content.
• Conducts independent data discovery in unexplored data schemas.
• Design, create, test and maintain a portfolio of reports, scorecards and dashboards.
• Practices a high level of integrity and honesty in maintaining confidentiality.
• Maintains rigorous data validation standards.
• Participate in enterprise-level metadata, master data management and data governance initiatives.
• Perform a consultative role through collaboration with the process improvement team.
• Present findings using verbal, written, and graphic communication techniques.
• Stay informed about Business Intelligence industry trends, technologies and best practices that can be applied to achieve business goals.
• Work closely with multiple internal stakeholders to analyze business needs and deliver relevant information in appropriate formats.
• Translate business requirements into technical and functional specifications. Design, develop and test deliverables based on specifications.
• Finds intrinsic value in documenting definitions, calculations, data source, and methodologies.
• Present complex information in a logical and understandable format to a wide variety of audiences.

Requirements
• 4+ years of experience in healthcare business intelligence, systems analysis, informatics or a related discipline, including requirements gathering, solution implementation, testing and validation.
• Ability to prioritize and act in an evolving environment.
• Ability to work with minimal supervision and lead small project / performance improvement teams if necessary.
• An innovative thinker that can quickly identify the source issue and turn ideas into solutions.
• Demonstrated proficiency in analyzing data to derive business insights and support performance improvement initiatives.
• Demonstrated proficiency in the collection, classification, dissemination, integration and visualization of complex information.
• Demonstrated proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite and Power Platform.
• Demonstrated expertise using visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
• Proficient in writing complex SQL statements on SQL Server and BigQuery
• Experience using GCP is a plus.
• Strong analytical skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Chicago, IL

GoodVets is a leading veterinary management organization looking to hire a Business Intelligence Analyst. Our hospitals are a premier destination for high-quality, full-service healthcare for pets and we are growing rapidly in multiple national markets. We have over 30 locations today and will have over 50 locations by the end of 2024. ...

The Business Intelligence Analyst will play a critical role in GoodVets’s data-driven approach. This individual will own reporting across the organization, including transforming data and managing datasets and building visualizations and dashboards. This individual will work with department leaders to understand and execute on reporting requirements to support actionable and data-driven decision-making. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, a keen eye for detail, and the ability to effectively communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.

The Impact You Will Have Every Day
• Design, develop and automate reports, dashboards and visualizations using DOMO
• Collaborate with business unit leaders to understand business requirements and deliver reporting that meets stakeholder requirements
• Maintain data integrity across all datasets and ensure accuracy across all reporting
• Enhance existing reporting

What We Look For
• Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems or a related field
• 5+ years of experience as a Consultant, BI Analyst, Data Analyst or similar role with a strong background in data analysis and visualization
• Experience with BI platforms such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker or DOMO, including data integration into the platforms, report/dashboard development and data visualization
• Proficiency in SQL and database management
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization
• Detail-oriented mindset with a focus on data accuracy, integrity, quality and actionability
• Excellent project management and organizational skills with ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

What We Offer
• Company paid healthcare
• 401(k) Retirement Plan with match
• Unlimited paid time off
• Team based bonuses
• Friendly employee discounts on veterinary services and products
• Dental and vision insurance
• Gym membership

If this sounds like the adventure you've been searching for, we can't wait to connect with you. Apply today and let's make an impact, together!

Compensation Range

$125,000—$135,000 USD

title: Lead Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Description

The Lead Business Intelligence Analyst position provides a key role within the Data Science department by working with the sales, product line management, and senior management teams on analytical initiatives to generate market opportunities leading to higher CME Group revenue and volume. Responsibilities include providing and maintaining customer 360 analytics for clients trading... futures & options, cash markets, data services, and colocation services. The position will manage and lead projects to produce analytics, visuals, and market opportunities using business intelligence and lead generation tools. In addition, this role will communicate analytics, promote business intelligence (BI) tools and acquire feedback on additional analysis. The position will assist with transitioning the Business Analytics team's current portfolio of performance reports to the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) to generate more insightful analytics and revenue opportunities.

Principal Accountabilities:
• Utilize Client 360 data and BI tools to generate new sources of revenue and sales opportunities. Utilize GCP tools to improve the team's reporting and data analytics by providing more insights and enhanced visualizations.
• Support the Client Development & Research (CD&R) division's Sales campaign efforts by creating client target lists and tracking reports to measure campaign effectiveness. Assist with identifying analytical needs, design scalable solutions, and lead work streams to deliver on campaign objectives.
• Support the Business Analytics team's monthly and quarterly reporting responsibilities by maintaining and enhancing current dashboards that provide analytics and visuals at the customer segment, product line, and regional level.
• Collaborate with Sales, Product Management, Investor Relations, and Corporate Communications to provide timely and insightful analytics for monthly and quarterly reporting. This position will perform a key role in transitioning current reports to GCP and Looker to improve analytics and insights.
• Assist departments within and outside of the CD&R division with the transition of current BI tools (e.g. QlikView) and reporting to GCP and Looker.

Skills and Software Requirements:
• Three to Five years of experience in Data Analytics with the following skill set:
• SQL experience at the intermediate to advanced level
• Python experience at the intermediate to advanced level

- Tableau Dashboard development - intermediate to advanced
• Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
• Machine Learning experience would be a plus
• GCP and Looker experience would be a plus
• Crucial to success is experience in utilizing Business Intelligence systems to produce quantitative analysis under time constraints, strong communication skills in presenting results and recommendations, and the ability to lead with conviction.
• Ability to present and communicate data analytics and ideas clearly in meetings across divisions is critical. Experience presenting technical material in both small and large group meetings is required.
• Heavy IT/Technology-focused individuals with CME Group business knowledge is ideal.

#LI-RP1

#LI-hybrid

CME Group: Where Futures Are Made

CME Group (www.cmegroup.com) is the world's leading derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.

At CME Group, we embrace our employees' diverse experiences, cultures and skills, and work to ensure that everyone’s perspectives are acknowledged and valued. As an equal opportunity employer, we recognize the importance of a diverse and inclusive workplace and consider all potential employees without regard to any protected characteristic

title: Enterprise Analytics Manager
description:
Qualifications

Job Overview...

As the Enterprise Analytics Manager, you will manage and deliver on enterprise-wide analytical projects and supports the effort to provide cross-functional collaboration on data and actionable intelligence. Under general direction of the Senior Enterprise Analytics Manager, you will support the operationalization and adoption of DFW's Data 360 Program for the business user community across the airport. You will also employ primary and secondary research strategies and coordinates analytics with third party resources and research organizations

What you will be doing:
• Promotes and supports the operationalization and adoption of the Data 360 initiative: assist in driving tenets of data democratization for business users across the airport.
• Advocates and promotes collaboration across departments/systems to develop, research, evaluate, and leverage core data analytics.
• Participates in the development of standardized reporting and KPIs across the enterprise.
• Develops and produces VP and executive level reports, dashboards and other analytics to enhance decisioning and accelerate execution of business strategy.
• Partners with the ITS in supporting the internal and external data ecosystem.
• Supports DFW's data strategy, leads in the Information Management process, and assists in driving results in partnership with DFW ITS in the Data Management process.
• Supports, demonstrates knowledge of, and participates in the implementation/administration of Data Governance program.
• Participates in the preparation and follow through of industry-related conferences, and other meetings.
• Participates in other cross-departmental research and analytics projects for DFW as needed.
• Participates in data and analysis tool selection (new tools) and evaluation process (existing tool set)
• Research and assist in the implementation of new methodologies to continually deliver added business value to internal and external customers.
• Advocates and promotes efforts to implement DFW's data catalogue. Participates and provides support to departments and mangers in the gathering, generation, and documentation efforts of metadata.
• Assist in monitoring of key aviation performance metrics on a regular basis and recommends action plans to address issues.

What you need:
• Bachelor's degree in information management, data science, business, marketing, aviation management or related field.
• Five (5) years of professional experience in data science, business intelligence, statistical analysis or similar disciplines. Any equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be substituted for the above.
• Any equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be substituted for the above.
• Ability to travel extensively domestically and internationally.
• Possession of a valid Class C driver's license.

What we desire:
• Master's degree in a related field.
• Experience with a major airport or airline.
• Strong statistical, forecasting, and analytical skills.
• Knowledge of the aviation industry operations.

About Us

We are Dallas Fort Worth International (DFW) Airport-one of the most successful airports in the world by any definition. We're recognized for our innovation, leadership, drive for excellence and talented employees.

Our success is made possible because of the diverse talents of over 2,000 employees who champion our mission of providing an exceptional airport experience to our customers and connect our community to the world. We're looking for the best talent to join us and help reimagine what an airport can be.

Bring your talents to DFW. Live and work with purpose

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
Location:

Rosedale Office Building...

Department:

IS Epic

Shift:

Standard Weekly Hours:

40

Summary:

Must be willing to relocate to the Dallas/Fort Worth area

The Business Intelligence (BI) Developer is an emerging data professional who designs, develops and implements analytics tools and data solutions. This individual understands business data needs, gathers requirements, analyzes data and develops robust analytics solutions for advanced projects, self-service analytics and business user consumption. The Business Intelligence Developer interfaces with clinical, financial and operational business leaders, subject matter experts as well as Information Services applications teams to design reports, dashboards and analytics that accurately reflect business workflows and drive action. The BI Developer plans, designs, architects, develops, tests and implements new BI solutions as well as troubleshoots, monitors and maintains existing BI solutions. The BI Developer writes relational and multidimensional database queries that meet performance objectives and business use cases. The BI Developer is familiar with data warehousing design and development methodologies. The Business Intelligence Developer ideally has experience with leading healthcare technology systems such as EMR (Epic), Claims processing (Epic), ERP (Workday), CRM, cloud based data platforms (Azure, Snowflake) etc.

Qualifications:
• High school diploma or GED required.
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Management Information Systems (MIS), Business or related/relevant degree AND minimum of 2 years of experience as a BI Developer, Data Analyst, Business Analyst, Operations Analyst, Data Engineer, Database Developer, and/or Technical/Systems/Application Analyst
• R Minimum of 4 years of experience as a BI Developer, Data Analyst, Business Analyst, Operations Analyst, Data Engineer, Database Developer, and/or Technical/Systems/Application Analyst.
• Experience with business intelligence tools: Microsoft BI stack, SAP Business Objects, TIBCO Spotfire, Tableau, SAS, Crystal Reports, etc.
• Experience programming in SQL, Python, R, SAS or equivalent programming languages.
• Experience writing relational and multidimensional database queries, database object development as well as data warehousing design and methodologies.
Demonstrated experience operating efficiently within the Business Intelligence development lifecycle.
• Proven experience with business and technical requirements gathering, analysis, and verification.
• Knowledge of planning, designing, architecting, developing and supporting BI solutions.
• Experience debugging, monitoring, and troubleshooting BI solutions.
• Experience creating and deploying highly visible reports/dashboards/analytics for business use.
• Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills.
• Must be available for support by pager or telephone 24 hours per day x 7 days per week.

Preferred:
• Minimum of 2 years of experience in a healthcare, provider and/or managed care/insurance environment preferred.
• Holds current Epic certifications: Epic Cogito, Caboodle Data Model, Clarity Data Model, and at least one of the following - Clinical/Patient Access/Revenue Cycle Data Model.
• Experience utilizing, developing and supporting Epic Cogito tools, including Radar Dashboards, Reporting Workbench Reports, Radar SQL Metrics, Crystal Reports, SlicerDicer, Analytics Catalog, registries, etc. preferred

Licensure, Registration, and/or Certification:
• Epic certification may be required for the position based on area focus.
• Employee must hold or obtain Epic certification within six (6) months of employment (including one allowed test retake).
• Required Epic certifications for BI Developers supporting Epic include: Epic Cogito, Caboodle Data Model, Clarity Data Model, and one of the following: Clinical/Patient Access/Revenue Cycle Data Model.
• Preferred: The required certifications above as well as additional relevant Cogito certifications or proficiencies such as Clinical/Patient Access/Revenue Cycle Data Models, SlicerDicer Custom Build Badge, Radar SQL Metrics Badge, Cogito SQL Badge, Caboodle-Clarity Development, Cogito Tools Administration, and/or other relevant Epic application certification(s).
• Microsoft SQL certification, Python certification and/or BI/analytics tool certification (Power BI, SAS, etc) a plus.

About Us:

Cook Children's Health Care System

Cook Children's Health Care System offers a unique approach to caring for children because we are one of the country's leading integrated pediatric health care delivery organizations. Patients benefit from the integrated system because it allows Cook Children's to use all of its resources to treat a patient and allows for easy communication between the various companies by physicians with a focus on caring for children and adolescents.

Cook Children's is an EOE/AA, Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran employer

title: BI Manager
description:
Tiger Analytics is an advanced analytics consulting firm. We are the trusted analytics partner for several Fortune 100 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our consultants bring deep expertise in Data Science, Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Business Intelligence, Machine Learning and AI. Our business value and leadership has been recognized by various market research... firms, including Forrester and Gartner.

The Tiger Analytics team is looking for a BI Technical Product Owner to deliver innovation and tools to global business teams. This is a cross functional role that requires strong interpersonal skills and the ability to liaison with technical teams and interact with internal clients.

Job Duties:
• Analyze business requirements and work with business stakeholders
• Communicate data architecture to development teams
• Consult and perform design reviews to ensure business needs are met
• Utilize Business Intelligence tools to build and support dashboards
• Partner with other team members as well as cross-functional partners to support business processes and system solutions
• Manage and resolve client issue escalation and systemic improvements
• Partner with Business Analysts to bring new scalable solutions to business functions
• Lead validation efforts to ensure data quality

Requirements
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.
• 6 + years of experience in a BI and Azure Space. Manager Experience is preferred.
• Ability to articulate pros and cons of various technologies and platforms and architectural options
• Knowledge of Power BI Business intelligence reporting tool is a must
• Knowledge of SSRS report development is a plus
• Knowledge of Azure services (ADF, Data Lake Gen 2) is needed. Azure Synapse is nice to have
• Experience and knowledge with Data Warehouse ETL process using SSIS packages is preferred
• Experience with tools and concepts related to data and analytics, such as dimensional modeling, ETL, reporting tools, data governance, data warehousing, structured and unstructured data
• Consulting experience highly preferred

Benefits

Significant career development opportunities exist as the company grows. The position offers a unique opportunity to be part of a small, fast-growing, challenging and entrepreneurial environment, with a high degree of individual responsibility

title: Legal, Business Intelligence Group, Associate- Dallas
description:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB:

LEGAL...

We work at the intersection of finance and law, providing counsel and advice that support activities across the firm. We handle litigation and arbitration, perform research and due diligence, aid in financing and legal filings, deal with contracts and intellectual property rights that show our commitment to clients, shareholders, and regulators. Whether youre an experienced attorney or a quick learner with a strong interest in financial law coupled with critical thinking skills, our dynamic group might be right for you.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:

BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE GROUP

The Business Intelligence Group (BIG) is an advisory group in the Legal Division that focusses on legal, regulatory and reputational risk, predominantly in relation to Investment Banking Division and principal investment transactions. BIG supports certain of the firms business lines and many of the firms committees in their efforts to make fully informed commercial and reputational risk management decisions. BIG is composed of lawyers and other professionals with regulatory, government, audit and transactional experience.

The BIG Americas team has offices in New York and Dallas and primarily covers transactions based out of North, South and Central America. Both offices work collaboratively across all transaction reviews and BIG operations.

HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL
• Conduct legal, regulatory and financial due diligence to assess reputational risk in a variety of transactions and business relationships
• Considerations include FCPA/anti-bribery compliance, environmental and social responsibility concerns, geo-political risk, financial irregularities, litigation risk, etc.
• Clients include revenue-generating departments across all divisions of the firm, as well as areas within the Federation
• Identify and evaluate risk-relevant information from sources, including but not limited to: online media, proprietary databases, regulatory lists, public filings, litigation records, research reports, various internet sources
• Instruct and liaise with external investigative consultants, evaluate reports and help drive the due diligence process to address issues identified, coordinating with in-house lawyers, external counsel, compliance and business teams.
• Review and analyze various independent reports on internal controls, quality of earnings, environmental impact, regulatory compliance, etc.
• Analyze financial statements and public filings to evaluate potential areas of concern
• Prepare summary and presentation materials for analysis by relevant business areas and firmwide committees
• Responsible for developing relevant industry/regional expertise and anticipating potential reputational risks
• Liaise with internal and external legal counsel on issues which merit further due diligence
• Other special projects on an ad hoc basis

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR
• 3-7 years of legal/regulatory, accounting, compliance or other financial experience
• Excellent analytical and communication skills (both oral and written)
• Risk assessment, preferably involving legal, regulatory, and/or compliance and/or reputational issues
• Strong technical proficiency experience in online research and databases preferred
• General experience dealing with the investment banking industry and knowledge of various types of investing and lending transactions
• Demonstrates a strong sense of intellectual curiosity and interest in current events
• Team player with inherent commercial judgment
• Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and, at times, pressured environment
• Strong sense of discretion with respect to highly confidential information
• Spanish language skills and/or Latin America research and due diligence experience is a plus, but not required
• CPA, CFA, CFE designations are a plus, but not required?

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS:

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at .

Were committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more:

The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2021. All rights reserved.
Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Sr Analyst, Air Service Development and Analytics
description:
Qualifications

Job Overview...

As the Sr. Analyst, Air Service Development and Analytics, you will provide key leadership in the execution of strategic and tactical plans to attract all airlines to this market and to increase flights in domestic and international markets. Under the general direction of the Senior Manager Airline Business Development, you will utilize a variety of industry sources to develop thorough airline business cases, route forecasts, and other analyses to support the strategic plan for market development.

What you will be doing: Bring the world to DFW and DFW to the world...
• Develop and implement the strategy to attract all airlines to this market and to increase flights in domestic and international markets.
• Build, based on market research, compelling business case recommendations to be presented to airline executives for new and expanded air service.
• Leads in the identification of under-served and emerging markets, proposing strategies for advancing DFW's market position.
• Build passenger and revenue forecasts for prospective routes.
• Creates thorough analysis for short-and long-term planning around airport infrastructure needs to support future airline growth.
• Professionally represent the airport at industry events with airline and agency partners, continuously improving relationships with these external stakeholders.

What you need:
• Bachelor's degree in business, finance/economics, marketing, aviation management or quantitative field.
• Three (3) years of professional experience in network/route planning, strategic planning, scheduling, revenue management, or related field in the aviation industry
• Ability to travel occasionally domestically and internationally.
• Possession of a valid Class C driver's license.

Desirable:
• Master's of Business Administration, Aviation Management or related field.
• Experience with a major airport or airline.
• Extensive experience in Tableau, Diio Mi, SQL data query, QSI modeling and forecasting
• Ability to speak a language in addition to English.
• Ability to communicate effectively and professionally to executive and Sr leadership, both in writing and orally.
• Cargo experience

About Us

We are Dallas Fort Worth International (DFW) Airport- one of the most successful airports in the world by any definition. We're recognized for our innovation, leadership, drive for excellence and talented employees.

Our success is made possible because of the diverse talents of nearly 2,000 employees who champion our mission of providing an exceptional airport experience to our customers and connect our community to the world. We're looking for the best talent to join us and help reimagine what an airport can be. Bring your talents to DFW. Live and work with purpose

title: SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) (Dallas/Ft. Worth)
description:
• *PLEASE NOTE: We are unable to provide employer sponsorship now or in the future for this role.

This role requires minimum 4 days on-site/in-office - Grapevine, TX...

The Kubota MDG Sr. Analyst is responsible for maintaining the techno-functional integrity of Kubota's MDG (Master Data Governance) solution. Their focus will be on material, BP-customer and vendor, and financial domain areas.

The MDG Sr. Analyst will report to the Kubota MDG Solutions Architect Manager and work closely with the Kubota Data Solutions Design team to ensure that the MDG Platform supports business requirements in a scalable and effective manner.

In addition to supporting deployment project teams and system integrators, the MDG Sr. Analyst will collaborate with other IT and functional teams to ensure solution designs align with the overall One Kubota enterprise architecture.

PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES:
• Support the Functional Consultant during business process discussions by means of interviews, workflow analyses and facilitated discussions with users.
• Translates users' business requirements into detailed functional designs for development, testing and implementation.
• Identifies and communicates risks and issues impacting business rules, functional requirements and specifications. Participates in and contributes to managing the scope of applications and related changes.
• Identifies and communicates risks and issues impacting business rules, functional requirements and specifications. Participates in and contributes to managing the scope of applications and related changes.
• Participate in UAT phase and go-live period of the MDG Implementation project to troubleshoot the issues in live system by engaging appropriate internal and external stakeholders, being responsive, leading the root cause analysis and thoughtful on upstream and downstream impacts of the change.
• Assists quality assurance with functional test case reviews. Creates training materials and may assist with user training.
• Drive continuous process improvements by monitoring and analyzing the KPIs, proposing process and system changes, providing the details on scope, estimate the cost of implementation, timelines, improve quality and the business outcomes.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
• Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Information Sciences/Technology, Supply Chain or related fields required.
• 5 years of experience in Development/ Configuration/solutions evaluation/ Validation and deployment of SAP MDG.
• At least 1 implementation / roll out experience in S4 HANA MDG implementation.
• Strong understanding of the MDG functional processes around Data model, UI, BRFs, Workflow enhancements objects for various master data elements like business partner (Customer/vendor), Material master, and Financial Master.
• Knowledgeable with SAP Customer and Material Master data domains.
• Experience developing and communicating MDG standards and MDM solutions across different business entities and functions.
• Expertise with SAP MDG configurations for Data modeling, UI modeling, process modeling, rules and derivations, BRF+, replication configurations.
